definition: clemency or mercy shown to a defeated opponent, to divide by four
details:
noun
- clemency or mercy shown to a defeated opponent
= example: clemency or mercy shown to a defeated opponent
- piece of leather that comprises the part of a shoe or boot covering the heel and joining the vamp
= example: piece of leather that comprises the part of a shoe or boot covering the heel and joining the vamp
- the rear part of a ship
= example: the rear part of a ship
= synonyms: tail
- a district of a city having some distinguishing character
= example: a district of a city having some distinguishing character
- an unspecified person
= example: an unspecified person
- a United States or Canadian coin worth one fourth of a dollar
= example: a United States or Canadian coin worth one fourth of a dollar
- a quarter of a hundredweight, 28 pounds
- one of four equal parts
= example: one of four equal parts
= synonyms: fourth, quartern, one-fourth, one-quarter, fourth part
- one of the four major division of the compass
= example: one of the four major division of the compass
- a fourth part of a year, usually in financial areas
= example: a fourth part of a year, usually in financial areas
- one of four periods into which the school year is divided
= example: one of four periods into which the school year is divided
- a unit of time equal to 15 minutes or a quarter of an hour
= example: a unit of time equal to 15 minutes or a quarter of an hour
- one of four timed divisions into which some games are divided
= example: one of four timed divisions into which some games are divided
verb
- to divide by four
= example: to divide by four
- to divide into quarters
= example: to divide into quarters
- to pull a person apart with four horses tied to their extremities, so as to execute them
= example: to pull a person apart with four horses tied to their extremities, so as to execute them
= synonyms: draw
- to provide housing for, usually used for military personnel
= example: to provide housing for, usually used for military personnel
= synonyms: billet
